Text:
It matters whether you continue to wear a mask.  
It matters whether you continue to socially distance.  
It matters whether you wash your hands.  

It all matters and can help save lives.

Tonight, in Washington, D.C. and across the nation, we came together to honor the over 400,000 Americans we’ve lost to COVID-19. The last year has tested us in unimaginable ways, but now it’s time we begin to heal and overcome — together. https://t.co/DuWhN1xjNO
Join us for a national moment of unity and remembrance in honor of the 400,000 Americans we’ve lost due to COVID-19. https://t.co/0BW7AQLxUx

Our Administration will lead with science and scientists — with a CDC and NIH that are free from political influence, a Surgeon General who is independent and speaks directly to the people, and an FDA whose decisions are based on science and science alone.
I know masks have become a partisan issue — but it’s a patriotic act. Experts say wearing a mask from now until April will save more than 50,000 lives.

We not only have an economic imperative to act now, we have a moral obligation. 
 
In this pandemic, in America, we cannot let people go hungry. We cannot let people get evicted. We cannot watch nurses and educators lose their jobs.

We must act.

My administration will move Heaven and Earth to:

- Allow more people to get vaccinated
- Create more places for them to get vaccinated
- Mobilize more medical teams to get shots in arms
- Increase vaccine supply and get it out the door as soon as possible

We need to tackle the public health and economic crises we’re facing head-on. That’s why today, I’m announcing my American Rescue Plan. Together we’ll change the course of the pandemic, build a bridge toward economic recovery, and invest in racial justice. https://t.co/UzGFZY7Jhp

We’re in the teeth of this crisis, and we need to take immediate action to get the virus under control. That’s why tomorrow, I’ll be laying out my vaccination and economic rescue package to beat COVID-19 and build back better. https://t.co/YRzJ5nlkDm

I urge every American to:

- Wear a mask
- Stay socially distanced
- Avoid large indoor gatherings

We can save countless lives if we step up together.

Getting America vaccinated will be one of the greatest operational challenges we’ve ever faced, but my administration will spare no effort to get it done.

We’re going to ensure the vaccine is distributed quickly, equitably, and free of charge to every American.

Folks, I just received the second dose of my COVID-19 vaccine — and just like the first dose, it was safe, quick, and painless. 

I urge everyone to get vaccinated once it’s your turn. Because only together can we save lives and beat this virus. https://t.co/w1m8gEh2iL
Mask up, folks.

The next few weeks and months are going to be a very tough period for our nation — maybe the toughest of the whole pandemic. 

But we are going to get through it. Brighter days are coming, but it’s going to take all the grit and determination we have as Americans to do it.

We can save 60,000-100,000 lives in the weeks and months ahead if we step up together.

Wear a mask. Stay socially distanced. Avoid large indoor gatherings.

Each of us has a duty to do what we can to protect ourselves, our families, and our fellow Americans.

We’re going to make sure vaccines are free of charge.

And we’re going to ensure they are distributed equitably, so every person who wants a vaccine can get one — no matter the color of their skin or where they live. https://t.co/uLQfxS1PM0

After ten months of the pandemic, we still don’t have enough testing. It’s a travesty.

We need to scale up testing so anyone who needs one can get one.
Once in office, I will be asking the American people to wear a mask for the first 100 days of my administration. Not as a political statement, but as a patriotic duty. https://t.co/0Uayw4sAs7
Tune in as I deliver remarks on the ongoing COVID-19 crisis and what my administration will do to get this virus under control. https://t.co/cW9z2nkEkP

This year, we’ve painfully learned the cost of being unprepared for a pandemic.
 
If we aren’t investing with our partners around the world, we’re undermining our ability to defeat COVID-19 and leaving ourselves vulnerable to the next deadly epidemic.

From COVID-19 and the economy to climate change and racial justice — our nation is facing four historic crises at once. And come January, there will be no time to waste. That’s why my team and I are hard at work preparing to take action on day one.

Here’s the simple truth: Our darkest days in this battle against COVID are ahead of us — not behind us.  
 
We need to prepare ourselves and steel our spines. https://t.co/TSn5hdpzGj

Yesterday, in an effort to instill confidence in the vaccine, I had my shot administered in public. 
 
I have absolute confidence in the vaccine and look forward to the second shot. https://t.co/5jeBLMY4z2

In the first 100 days of my administration, we will:

- Ask all Americans to mask up
- Administer 100 million vaccine shots
- Get most schools back open

We’re going to contain the virus and get back to our lives.

I applaud this relief package, but our work is far from over. Starting in the new year, Congress will need to immediately get to work on support for our COVID-19 plan.

My message to everyone out there struggling right now: help is on the way. https://t.co/ktET5loEnm

Today, I received the COVID-19 vaccine.

To the scientists and researchers who worked tirelessly to make this possible — thank you. We owe you an awful lot.

And to the American people — know there is nothing to worry about. When the vaccine is available, I urge you to take it. https://t.co/QBtB620i2V

I’m prepared to sign a COVID relief package on day one, but I need @ReverendWarnock and @ossoff in the Senate to get it done.

Georgia — Make your plan to vote early today: https://t.co/RIJ1L4juwB https://t.co/G9lRQQawH7

In America, politicians don’t take power — the people grant it to them. 

The flame of democracy was lit in this nation a long time ago.

And we now know that nothing — not even a pandemic or an abuse of power — can extinguish that flame.

Georgia — in-person early voting starts today. Head to https://t.co/RIJ1L4juwB to find all the information you need to make your voice heard.

Wear a mask, practice social distancing, and help flip the Senate.

We’re in the teeth of the COVID-19 crisis right now, and this nation needs presidential leadership.

Leadership that is willing to model the steps we all should be taking in our own lives.
For your family, neighbors, and country — wear a mask. https://t.co/tTYxY6D0YA
Congress needs to act now on a COVID relief package. The American people can’t wait. https://t.co/NCZADDAKDd

Wear a mask. 
 
It's the easiest thing you can do to reduce COVID cases, hospitalizations, and deaths.

It's not a political statement — it's a patriotic act.
My first 100 days won’t end COVID-19, but we can slow the spread, save lives, and get back to our lives with our loved ones. https://t.co/nz2YkjhQZa

Beating COVID-19 will take everyone doing their part.

Wear a mask. Social distance. Limit travel over the holidays. 

We can end this, together.

Yesterday marked another tragic, preventable milestone in our fight against COVID-19, but this news is a bright light. I’m grateful for every scientist, researcher, and public health expert who made it possible. https://t.co/ooDP8SZFrk

This pandemic is one of the toughest challenges America has ever faced.

But I know that together we will overcome — and heal — as one nation. https://t.co/S8OeP7HJVH

This health team is made up of world-class experts at the top of their fields who are ready on day one to get the pandemic under control so we can get back to work, back to our lives, and back to our loved ones. https://t.co/acwVxRQS6x
Out of our collective pain, we will find our collective purpose: to control the pandemic, to save lives, and to heal as a nation.
Dr. Fauci is trusted, a truth teller, and a patriot. I’m grateful he’ll be a key member of my COVID team as we work to get this virus under control. https://t.co/kFpeuNbXbc

Today, I'm announcing key COVID-19 priorities for the first 100 days of my administration:

- Everyone wears a mask
- 100 million vaccinations
- Reopen the majority of schools

With these steps, we can change the course of the disease and change life in America for the better.

I need a team that’s ready on day one to contain the pandemic and ensure everyone has access to quality, affordable health care. This is that team. Tune in as I introduce them for the first time. https://t.co/FhbbTa7xEo

Dr. Fauci isn't just one of our foremost experts on combating viruses—he is a good man and a tireless public servant. He has served six presidents and led us through some of our toughest challenges.

Our administration, and our country, will be stronger because of his guidance.
I promise you this: I will spare no effort — or commitment — to end this pandemic.

With COVID-19 cases rising across the nation, we need to ramp up our production of personal protective equipment. We have to ensure our brave health care workers have everything they need to safely battle this virus.
Our country is in the middle of a dramatic spike in COVID-19 cases. Please wear a mask, keep social distancing, and limit the size of any groups. It’s our patriotic duty as Americans.

On the day I’m inaugurated, I’ll call on the public to wear a mask for 100 days.

Let’s keep our fellow Americans safe and save lives. https://t.co/HrMbxNgXrw
As soon as Dr. Fauci declares we have a safe vaccine, I’ll take it. https://t.co/A3peYhhOvR
Once a vaccine is ready and approved, @KamalaHarris and I are going to ensure it’s distributed equitably, efficiently, and free of charge to every American.

Yesterday, I spent the afternoon hearing from workers and small business owners on the economic impact COVID-19 has had on their lives. Americans are hurting — it’s why as president, I’ll work to provide immediate relief and get our economy back on track. https://t.co/Cyw0DhJCpP

We have no time to lose to address the economic crisis we face and build our economy back better.

This team will be ready on Day One to pull every lever of government to help those hardest hit by COVID-19 and right the structural inequalities in our economy. https://t.co/cQ2MqV0mIW
Let me be clear: Wearing a mask is not about making your life less comfortable or taking something away. It’s to give something back to all of us — a normal life.

Small businesses are the backbone of communities across the country — and amid the pandemic, they need our help more than ever. Today, and every day, support your neighbors and strengthen your community by shopping small. #SmallBusinessSaturday https://t.co/MG9fwMi2sQ

This is the moment where we need to steel our spines, redouble our efforts, and recommit ourselves to the fight against COVID-19.

Let’s remember: We are all in this together. https://t.co/eliNEe7XCL

The COVID-19 pandemic has made matters worse, creating a “shadow pandemic” for many women and girls who are largely confined to their home with their abuser and facing economic insecurity that makes escape more difficult.
The challenge before us right now is immense — we need bold action to fight this pandemic. That’s why @KamalaHarris and I are getting right to work preparing to get this virus under control.

I believe America is strongest when we work with our allies.

It's how we keep this country safe, counter terrorism and extremism, control this pandemic, deal with the climate crisis, and so much more.

Vice President-elect @KamalaHarris and I spent the afternoon meeting with a bipartisan group of mayors. It was just the start of what I know will be a strong partnership in the months and years ahead. Together, we’re going to beat COVID-19 and build back better. https://t.co/2oiKD7gxAi
Anyone who wants a COVID-19 test should be able to get one. Period.

To the families and friends of those we've lost due to COVID-19 — Jill and I send our love and prayers.

We know how tough it is to find purpose in the memory of the loved one you lost. It will take time — but you will find it, and we will find our purpose as a nation. https://t.co/paD7CcG8ns
Wearing a mask isn't a political statement — it's a patriotic duty.

This afternoon, @KamalaHarris and I met with a bipartisan group of governors from the @NatlGovsAssoc’s Executive Committee. We might be Democrats and Republicans, but we’re Americans first — and together, we’re going to beat COVID-19. https://t.co/pEkHtf4l4d

Throughout the pandemic, our nation’s governors have stepped up to meet the moment. @KamalaHarris and I just met with the @NatlGovsAssoc to discuss how we’ll work together to combat COVID-19. Tune in. https://t.co/YiTjkIStbU

The workers on the frontlines of this pandemic are making extraordinary sacrifices every single day. They deserve leaders who will listen and work as hard for them as they are for their communities. As president, that’s exactly what I’ll do. https://t.co/wDu0p3sUQ2

The health care workers on the frontlines of this pandemic are true heroes. Tune in as we thank them for their work and discuss how a Biden-Harris administration will support them. https://t.co/RpBLnot7Be

Right now, Congress should come together and pass a COVID relief package like the HEROES Act that the House passed six months ago. Once we shut down the virus and deliver economic relief to workers and businesses, then we can build back better than ever before.

Today's news of a second vaccine is further reason to feel hopeful. What was true with the first vaccine remains true with the second: we are still months away. Until then, Americans need to continue to practice social-distancing and mask-wearing to get the virus under control.

I am the president-elect, but will not be president until next year. COVID-19 does not respect dates on the calendar, it is accelerating right now. Urgent action is needed today, now, by the current administration.
I am alarmed by the surge in reported COVID-19 infections, hospitalizations, and fatalities. This crisis demands a robust and immediate federal response which has been woefully lacking.

.@KamalaHarris and I aren’t wasting any time. We’re ready to get COVID-19 under control so that we can reopen our businesses and schools safely, resume our lives, and put this pandemic behind us. https://t.co/65C1XfR9rR
I won't be president until January 20th, but my message today to everyone is this: wear a mask.
The bottom line: I will spare no effort to turn this pandemic around.
The challenge before us right now is still immense and growing, and so is the need for bold action to fight this pandemic.
My COVID-19 Transition Advisory Board will advise on detailed plans built on a bedrock of science, and that keep compassion, empathy, and care for every American at its core.

Today, I have named a COVID-19 Transition Advisory Board, comprised of distinguished public health experts, to help our transition team translate the Biden-Harris COVID-19 plan into a blueprint we can put into place as soon as @KamalaHarris and I are sworn into office.

I spent the morning with the co-chairs of my COVID-19 Council discussing the status of this pandemic and how we move forward. Tune in as I provide an update on how we're going to beat this virus. https://t.co/VVGHZNnUFY
To all those who volunteered, worked the polls in the middle of this pandemic, local election officials — you deserve a special thanks from this nation.

What is becoming clearer each hour is that record numbers of Americans — from all races, faiths, regions — chose change over more of the same. 

They have given us a mandate for action on COVID and the economy and climate change and systemic racism.

I spent the afternoon attending briefings on the ongoing COVID-19 crisis and the state of the economy. Tune in as I provide an update on these briefings and efforts to count every vote. https://t.co/duoDWfzf5C

Under President Trump:

- Over 230,000 Americans have died from COVID-19
- 30 million people have lost hours, paychecks, or jobs
- Nearly one in five small businesses have closed

Are you better off than you were four years ago?
President Trump ignored the pandemic playbook that President Obama and I left him, so we decided to bring it back out and go over what he missed. https://t.co/ZHq5OCZwaN

A Biden-Harris administration will:

- Implement nationwide mask mandates
- Ensure access to regular, reliable, and free testing
- Accelerate the development and distribution of safe and effective treatments and vaccines

We won’t waste any time getting this virus under control.

In public, President Trump compared COVID-19 to the flu and suggested people inject bleach to treat it.

In private, he told Bob Woodward it was deadlier than the flu and that he wanted to downplay it.

It’s unthinkable.

Mask up and vote.

https://t.co/eoxT07uII9 https://t.co/Z1gz3AkbgW
This is my commitment to you: We will make sure every American has access to a free and safe COVID-19 vaccine.
We need a president who actually listens to experts like Dr. Fauci.
Donald Trump’s COVID-19 response has been the greatest failure of presidential leadership in our nation’s history.

Donald Trump is trying to eliminate the entire Affordable Care Act in the middle of a pandemic.

If he gets his way, more than 100 million Americans with pre-existing conditions could see their costs skyrocket or be denied coverage altogether.

We can’t let him win. https://t.co/DoTV2uw1bn

More than 230,000 Americans have died from COVID-19 –– and Donald Trump has given up on trying to get the virus under control.

He may have quit on you, but I promise I never will.

Presidents lead by example.

Mask up. https://t.co/eSvTmjmaYK
Be a patriot. Wear a mask. https://t.co/o2v9xP24A9
Every single American deserves access to regular, reliable, and free COVID-19 testing. Period.

President Trump still has no plan to address COVID-19.

He quit on you, on your family, on America. He just wants us to grow numb to the horrors of the death toll and the pain.

We cannot afford another four years of his failed leadership.

More than 9 million cases of COVID-19 have been now confirmed in the United States — and more than 228,000 Americans have lost their lives.

It is as severe an indictment of a president’s record as one can possibly imagine, and it is utterly disqualifying.

You have my word: if I have the honor of serving as your president, I will do everything in my power to defeat COVID-19.

Here’s my plan to get it done: https://t.co/zUWDfi0yQ8
The election is underway across the country, and we need your help to spread the word on social media. Sign up to help, and let’s win this thing: https://t.co/Yys11DiWVm

It’s not political.

It’s patriotic.

Wear a mask. Period.

You can't make this up: Yesterday, the White House science office put out a statement listing "ending the COVID-19 pandemic" as the top accomplishment of President Trump's first term. 
https://t.co/46VkWJE0GN
The hard truth is it didn't have to be this bad. But Donald Trump's shortsighted actions weakened our ability to respond to a pandemic long before COVID-19 reached our shores. https://t.co/qTdtIQgmZU
President Trump continues to prove just how unfit he is to lead our nation through a global pandemic.

On Thursday, President Trump said we're "rounding the turn" when it comes to COVID-19.

On Friday, we set a new record for daily cases. 

We're paying the price for his failures every single day. https://t.co/j12Yv9uYOH
Wearing a mask is not a political statement. https://t.co/HStwvMX95O

A slight change of tone from the president for one night doesn’t cover up the lies he told. It doesn’t change the fact that over 220,000 Americans have died from COVID-19 on his watch.

We can’t take another four years of Donald Trump’s failed leadership.
After eight months of this pandemic, we finally found President Trump's plan to beat COVID-19. https://t.co/KO4g328Uvr
.@BarackObama is right: President Trump wants full credit for the economy he inherited and zero blame for the pandemic he ignored. https://t.co/tCD5UST32J

It’s time we replace Secretary Betsy DeVos with an actual public school educator — one who values our public schools and is capable of guiding all of our schools through this pandemic.

Vote: https://t.co/eoxT07d7QB https://t.co/CWf3H5BqOH

Mr. President, the people are tired. They’re tired of your lies about this virus. They’re tired of watching more Americans die, and more people lose their jobs because you refuse to take this pandemic seriously. https://t.co/pdxdo3FadB
Yesterday, @realDonaldTrump decided to attack Dr. Fauci once again, calling him a ‘disaster’ and public health experts ‘idiots.’ Meanwhile, he still has no plan to beat this virus.
Wear a mask. Wash your hands. Vote out Donald Trump.

COVID-19 cases are on the rise across the nation.

But instead of leading by example, Donald Trump continues to put others in danger with his campaign events that ignore expert-recommended precautions.

Every day he proves just how unfit he is to lead America through this crisis.

In the middle of a pandemic, President Trump is trying to eliminate Obamacare and increase health care costs for millions.

Now, he’s rushing through a U.S. Supreme Court justice to help him get it done. It’s unconscionable. 

Make no mistake: Health care is on the ballot.
The words of a president matter. And when a president doesn't wear a mask or makes fun of folks who do, it has consequences.

Over 215,000 Americans have died from COVID-19, and what is President Trump doing?

Nothing.

We're eight months into this pandemic, and Donald Trump still doesn't have a plan to get this virus under control.

I do.

Not only was the individual 50+ feet away and wearing a mask, but I was wearing an N-95 mask. No members of my staff were in contact with this crew member either.  My doctors have advised that there is no need for me to quarantine.

During our contact tracing, we discovered around noon today that a member of the company that charters my airplane has also tested positive for COVID. This crew member was on the plane with me, but was more than 50 feet away. 

My COVID test from last night came back negative.

The fact that Senate Republicans haven’t bothered to pass a COVID relief package but are rushing through President Trump’s Supreme Court pick says all you need to know.

We’ve got to flip the Senate, folks.

If President Trump has his way in the U.S. Supreme Court, long-term complications from COVID-19, like lung scarring and heart damage, will become pre-existing conditions that could result in higher premiums or denied coverage.

It’s unconscionable.

215,000 Americans have died from COVID-19 on Donald Trump’s watch. 

It’s the greatest failure of presidential leadership in our nation’s history.

Donald Trump is running TV ads taking Dr. Fauci out of context and without his permission.

So, here’s a message from the President in his own words. https://t.co/WCYbIfrQLR

When President Trump was told one thousand Americans were dying every day from COVID-19, he shrugged it off and said, "it is what it is."

It is what it is?

This president doesn't even pretend to care about the Americans he swore to serve. It's disgraceful.

The fact is this pandemic has exposed the cracks in our already broken mental health care system.

We can and must do better.

As president, I’ll fight to achieve mental health parity, expand access to care, and wipe out the stigma. #WorldMentalHealthDay
40,000 people a day are coming down with the coronavirus. What is the matter with this guy? https://t.co/N71KynIX2k
Why did Donald Trump tell Bob Woodward the truth about COVID-19, but not the American people?

Congratulations to the UN World Food Program. With global hunger on the march, made worse by the pandemic and conflict around the world, we must come together to fight food insecurity. As president, I'll support the WFP and reassert American leadership to address global hunger. https://t.co/mt5uwCG5zT

When Governor Whitmer worked to protect her state from a deadly pandemic, President Trump issued a call to "LIBERATE MICHIGAN!"

That call was heard.

He's giving oxygen to the bigotry and hate we see on the march in our country — and we have to stop it.

As president, I will:

- Implement nationwide mask mandates
- Ensure access to regular, reliable, and free testing
- Accelerate the development of treatments and vaccines

I won’t waste any time getting this virus under control.

The pandemic is not a red state versus blue state issue. The virus doesn’t care where you live or what political party you belong to.

It infects us all. It will take anyone’s life. It is a virus — not a political weapon.

Folks, we can save nearly 100,000 lives by the end of the year if everyone wears a mask in public.

Do your part. Protect your neighbors. Wear a mask.
Wear a mask. https://t.co/TSuLuzAXEB
I view wearing a mask as a patriotic duty — to protect those around you. #BidenTownHall
Now that President Trump is busy tweeting campaign messages, I would ask him to do this: Listen to the scientists. Support masks. Support mask mandates nationwide.

Be a patriot. Do your part.

Wearing a mask will protect you. But it will also protect those around you — your mom, your dad, your son, your daughter, your neighbor, your co-worker.

Don’t just do it for yourself. Do it for the people you love.

I’m happy to report that Jill and I have tested negative for COVID. Thank you to everyone for your messages of concern. I hope this serves as a reminder: wear a mask, keep social distance, and wash your hands.

Donald Trump will do everything he can to distract from the fact that because of his failed COVID-19 response:

- Over 200,000 Americans have died
- 26 million are on unemployment
- 1 in 6 small businesses risk permanent closure

We can’t let him.

It's safe to say I've gotten to know the hardworking men and women of @Amtrak over the years — I'm proud to stand with them as they face furloughs due to funding cuts.

These essential workers have kept us moving during this pandemic –– now it's time we have their backs. https://t.co/aoaTYZdhoF

On average, roughly 750 to 1,000 Americans are dying from COVID every day.

When Donald Trump was presented with that number, he said, “It is what it is.”

It is what it is because Donald Trump is who he is. https://t.co/OOm2pVRijz

Here's the deal: Until we deal with COVID-19, we'll never get our economy fully back on track, get our kids safely back to school, or get our lives back.

It's why as president, I won't waste a day getting this virus under control. https://t.co/xjxsDmKPe3

In the middle of a pandemic, Donald Trump is trying to force through the confirmation of a Justice who will help him destroy Obamacare.

Health care is at stake. Protections for pre-existing conditions are at stake.

We can't let them win. https://t.co/zIdPmxzYtQ

When Ebola hit, President Obama and I took swift action and successfully contained the virus.

After COVID-19 hit, President Trump lied to the American people and said it would miraculously "disappear."

Now, over 200,000 lives have been cut short.

It's a national tragedy.

If I'm elected, I won't wait to take action on COVID-19.

Minutes after the race is called, I’ll call Dr. Fauci and ask him to stay on.

During my transition, I’ll bring together experts and leaders from both parties to chart a path forward.

We will overcome this, together.

In the middle of a global pandemic, President Trump is trying to get the U.S. Supreme Court to eliminate Obamacare and rip health care protections away from 100 million Americans with pre-existing conditions.

Don't forget that.

The Trump Administration says "the entire ACA must fall."

They are arguing to strip millions of Americans of health care in the middle of a pandemic.

We can't let him win. https://t.co/bcwiGz1HOn

The 200,000 people we've lost to COVID-19 weren't nobodies, Mr. President.

They were our parents and grandparents, sons and daughters, friends and co-workers.

They were Americans. https://t.co/EcdaEiwgUS

200,000 Americans have died from this virus.

It’s a staggering number that’s hard to wrap your head around. But behind every COVID-19 death is a family and community that will never again be the same.

There’s a devastating human toll to this pandemic — and we can’t forget that.

Today, we'll pass another grim milestone in this pandemic: 200,000 American lives lost.

Jill and I are keeping everyone who's hurting in our prayers. No words can numb your pain, but know the nation grieves with you.

Today is dark, but we will overcome this. Keep the faith.
Our frontline workers have sacrificed so much during this pandemic — the least President Trump could do is tell them the truth. https://t.co/TuLCCfnRHx

When we needed Donald Trump to tell the truth about COVID-19, he lied to us.

When we needed him to take action to contain its spread, he spent his days golfing.

When we needed a president the most, he was nowhere to be found.

It's unforgivable.
President Trump knew how deadly COVID-19 was and did nothing. It’s close to criminal. #BidenTownHall https://t.co/OL3uIA1QSZ

The 100 richest Americans have made more than $300 billion during the COVID-19 crisis.
 
Now, in the middle of a pandemic and economic crisis, Donald Trump wants to give them a $29 billion tax break.
 
Let that sink in.

We've had to endure President Trump's incompetence and dishonesty when it comes to testing, wearing masks, and socially distancing. 
 
We can't afford a repeat of those fiascos with a COVID-19 vaccine.

The stakes are too high.

Yesterday, I met with some of our nation's top experts to discuss how we distribute a safe and effective COVID-19 vaccine. If I win this election, I know that there won't be a minute to waste. I'll get to work on day one implementing an effective distribution plan. https://t.co/GfgSnBwjTQ

We all want a COVID-19 vaccine as soon as possible, but it needs to be based on science — not politics. Tune in as I discuss how we can develop and equitably distribute a safe and effective vaccine: https://t.co/KPxTaqAiVd

We’ve lost nearly 200,000 Americans to COVID-19. 

It didn’t have to be this bad — but Donald Trump failed to do his job.
Donald Trump is not responsible for COVID-19, but he is responsible for his failed response and for lying to the American people. https://t.co/cWuEoHiUxj

This morning, parents all across the West — already worried about their kids being indoors because of COVID-19 — are now also waking up worried about their kids being outside.

We need a president who takes climate change seriously.

Donald Trump is holding a rally in Michigan today—while also refusing to fully fund their National Guard.

These are frontline workers against COVID-19, responsible for testing and distributing food and medical supplies.

Michiganders need a pandemic response—not a pep rally. https://t.co/UkEqVv9zXe
Do your part. Wear a mask. https://t.co/pdnEecS49Q

Donald Trump knew that COVID-19 was dangerous. He knew it was deadly. And he purposely downplayed it.

Update on delivery schedules from Pfizer: We’ll now get at least 1 million doses of their COVID-19 vaccine each week from March 22nd to May 10th. We’ve shared these details with the provinces and territories so they can keep planning for mass vaccinations.

What a year it’s been. Like many of you, the premiers and I have spent a lot of time on the phone and in virtual meetings - we’ve met 28 times over the past 12 months. Our most recent meeting was today, and we took a moment to reflect on how COVID-19 has impacted Canadians.

Quelle année ce fut. Comme bon nombre d’entre vous, les premiers ministres et moi avons passé beaucoup de temps au téléphone et dans des réunions virtuelles. On a tenu aujourd’hui notre 28e réunion depuis les 12 derniers mois sur les effets de la COVID-19 sur les Canadiens.

To mark the National Day of Observance for COVID-19, and to honour those we’ve lost over the past year, we held a moment of silence in the House today. Together, we mourn. Together, we remember. Together, we will get through this. https://t.co/INeiCRbN1g

Over the past year, 22,000 Canadians have died from COVID-19. They were mothers, fathers, and grandparents. They were our neighbours, friends, and colleagues. To honour their memory, I’m delivering a statement in the House of Commons. Watch it live: https://t.co/G7FYXYREse

One year ago, COVID-19 was officially declared a pandemic. Today, on this National Day of Observance, we honour every parent, child, and friend who lost their life to this disease - and we stand with the people they loved as they continue to cope with this unimaginable loss.

Il y a un an, la COVID-19 a officiellement été déclarée une pandémie. En cette Journée nationale de commémoration, nous honorons toutes les personnes qui ont perdu la vie en raison de cette maladie et sommes solidaires de leurs proches, qui vivent encore ce deuil inimaginable.

The maximum rate for the Canada Emergency Wage Subsidy will remain at 75%, the maximum rate for the Canada Emergency Rent Subsidy will remain at 65%, and Lockdown Support will remain at 25% - providing rent support of up to 90% for businesses in communities that are locked down.

We’re extending the current rates for the Canada Emergency Wage Subsidy, Canada Emergency Rent Subsidy, and Lockdown Support until June 5th. Because as we’ve said before, we’ve got your back - and we’ll keep doing everything we can to support you through these tough times.

This will help @CHUDeQuebec create a program to speed up vaccine production. It’ll help researchers at @RyersonU develop made-in-Canada technologies that will make our communities cleaner. And it’ll fund projects that tackle climate change, maternal and child health, and more.

This morning, Minister @FP_Champagne and I announced an investment in more than 100 research projects and almost 1,000 researchers across the country - making sure they have the support they need to beat this pandemic and help us build a more resilient country.

If your results come back negative, you’ll be able to quarantine at home. This quarantine is mandatory and will be enforced. If your test results come back positive for COVID-19, you’ll be required to immediately quarantine in designated government facilities.

Canada and the US share one of the strongest and deepest friendships between any two countries in the world. On Tuesday, I’ll be meeting virtually with @POTUS @JoeBiden - we’ll focus on ending the pandemic, growing the middle class and creating jobs, and fighting climate change.

Update on our border: To keep you safe and limit the spread of COVID-19, we’ve extended the measures currently in place at the Canada-US border by another 30 days. Non-essential travel between our two countries remains restricted until at least March 21st, 2021.

Mise à jour sur nos frontières : pour vous protéger et limiter la propagation de la COVID-19, on prolonge de 30 jours les mesures en place à la frontière canado-américaine. Les déplacements non essentiels entre nos pays demeureront restreints jusqu’au 21 mars 2021.

G7 leaders logged on again today to speak about the challenges our countries - and all countries - are facing, and the opportunity we have to tackle them together. For the past year, women have been at the forefront of our fight against COVID-19. From Dr. Tam (@CPHO_Canada) to Dr. Nemer (@ChiefSciCan), to many other public health officials, scientists, and front line workers across the country, they’ve been keeping us all safe and healthy.

Cette année, les femmes ont été aux premiers rangs de la lutte contre la COVID-19. La Dre Tam (@ACSP_Canada), la Dre Nemer (@SciChefCan) et toutes les responsables de santé publique, scientifiques et travailleuses de première ligne au pays ont su veiller sur nous et notre santé.

@GeriMedMD @McDevonMD @janinemccready @michael_detsky @larry_jacobs1 I appreciated the chat - Dr. McCready’s firsthand knowledge is extremely valuable in the fight against COVID-19, and the testing program she and her team are working on has been incredibly informative. Thanks again, @JanineMcCready.

The pandemic isn’t over yet, and neither is our support for you. We’re providing one year without interest on certain 2020 tax debt - giving you more time to pay amounts you owe and making sure you can get back on your feet. To see if you’re eligible, check out the post below. ⤵️ https://t.co/VLLY5IND2a

Three other companies have submitted their vaccines for review by @GovCanHealth, too - AstraZeneca, Janssen, and Novavax. This review process is independent and has the highest standards to make sure that every vaccine approved in Canada is both safe and effective.

Update on vaccines: Starting next week, we’re expecting hundreds of thousands vaccine doses each week - and that’s just from Pfizer. With these shipments, we remain on track to receive 20 million doses from Pfizer and Moderna this spring.

Last month, our COVID-19 Testing and Screening Expert Advisory Panel released their first report. In it, they provided evidence-based advice on testing and screening techniques - and encouraged the use of rapid tests to prevent outbreaks and keep people safe.

Update: We’ve distributed more than 19 million rapid tests to the provinces and territories since the beginning of the pandemic, and more are on the way. These tests are key to keeping COVID-19 under control - especially in long-term care homes, schools, and workplaces.

Le mois dernier, le Comité consultatif d’experts en matière de tests et de dépistage de la COVID-19 a publié son 1er rapport. Il y donne des conseils factuels sur le dépistage et les tests et encourage le recours aux tests rapides pour prévenir les éclosions et protéger les gens.

Mise à jour : on a distribué plus de 19 M de tests rapides aux provinces et territoires durant la pandémie, et d’autres s’en viennent. Ils sont essentiels pour maîtriser la COVID‑19, particulièrement dans les centres de soins de longue durée, les écoles et les milieux de travail.

Ian Shugart, the Clerk of the Privy Council, is leading our public service during this crisis and working tirelessly on supports to help Canadians through the pandemic. As he faces health challenges, I want him to know that we’re all pulling for him.

For the latest on the COVID-19 situation, our vaccine rollout, and the work we’re doing to support you and your family through this challenging time, tune in to my Tuesday update now: https://t.co/LGUFyg2spe

There’s help available for small business owners, too. There’s the Canada Emergency Rent Subsidy, which could cover up to 65% of your rent. If your community is in lockdown, your rent subsidy could be boosted up to 90% with the Lockdown Support.

There’s the Canada Recovery Sickness Benefit, which is available if you’re not able to work because you’re sick or need to self-isolate due to COVID-19. If you can’t work because you’re taking care of a loved one, the Canada Recovery Caregiving Benefit is available for you.

There’s the Canada Recovery Benefit, which is available if you’re directly affected by COVID-19 but are self-employed or don’t quality for Employment Insurance. This benefit will provide you with $500 each week for up to 26 weeks.

Si travailler est impossible pour cause de maladie/d’isolement en raison de la COVID-19, il y a la Prestation canadienne de maladie pour la relance économique. Si c’est pour vous occuper d’un proche, il y a la Prestation canadienne de la relance économique pour proches aidants.

Les travailleurs autonomes ou ceux qui n’ont pas droit à l’assurance-emploi et qui sont directement touchés par la COVID-19 peuvent recevoir la Prestation canadienne de la relance économique. Ils toucheront 500 $ par semaine, jusqu’à 26 semaines.

On the phone yesterday, @EmmanuelMacron and I covered lots of ground. We spoke about the pandemic, our vaccine rollouts, and the need for equitable access to those vaccines. We also talked about the #OnePlanetSummit and many other global issues. https://t.co/R5ZdT3ejIf

I connected virtually with @Erna_Solberg this morning to speak about COVID-19, vaccines, and support for vulnerable countries. For more on our conversation - which also touched on other global issues and the relationship between our countries - click here: https://t.co/EGVbs9d9gk

I touched base with @FordNation this morning to discuss our vaccine rollout. We’re working together to get as many vaccines to Canadians as possible - and with doses being delivered every week, the federal government will keep doing everything we can to support the province.

We’ve let the provinces and territories know how many vaccines they’ll be getting each week between now and the end of February - and we’ll keep working to get even more vaccines delivered as soon as we can. For more on our vaccine rollout, click here: https://t.co/qDb6YjLoCP

By mid-spring - between April and June - we’ll have enough doses to vaccinate up to 20 million people across the country. And as we’ve said before, we’re on track to have every Canadian who wants a vaccine receive one by September.

Update on vaccines: We’ve reached an agreement with Pfizer for an additional 20 million doses of their COVID-19 vaccine. Thanks to our agreements with Moderna and Pfizer, we anticipate having 80 million doses of COVID-19 vaccines arriving this year from those companies alone.

Le point sur les vaccins : on a conclu un accord pour obtenir 20 millions de doses supplémentaires du vaccin contre la COVID-19 de Pfizer. Grâce à nos accords avec Moderna et Pfizer, on recevra cette année 80 millions de doses de vaccin de ces deux entreprises.

Les premières doses du vaccin contre la COVID-19 de Moderna sont arrivées au Canada. Elles font partie des 168 000 doses que nous recevrons d’ici la fin du mois et des 40 millions de doses que nous avons réservées de Moderna au total. https://t.co/JOAPSGpZIT

This afternoon, I connected with @NoubarAfeyan - he’s a former Montrealer, fellow McGill graduate, and the cofounder of Moderna. We spoke about their COVID-19 vaccine, which @GovCanHealth approved today, and the work we’re doing to distribute doses as quickly as possible. https://t.co/L4YFLOo5B2

Cet après-midi, j’ai parlé avec @NoubarAfeyan - diplômé de McGill, cofondateur de Moderna et ancien résident de Montréal - du vaccin de Moderna contre la COVID-19, approuvé aujourd’hui par @GouvCanSante, et du travail qu’on fait pour le distribuer le plus rapidement possible. https://t.co/TKfs2eH4Ka

The latest on vaccines: The first doses of Moderna’s COVID-19 vaccine will arrive in Canada in the coming days - and we’ll roll them out across the country as soon as possible. As for the Pfizer vaccine, we’ll be receiving an additional quarter of a million doses next month.

As the longest-serving Chief of the Defence Staff, General Vance has led the @CanadianForces as they defended our country against military threats, protected us from COVID-19, and more. Thank you, General Vance, for your service and leadership.

À titre de chef d’état-major de la défense le plus longtemps en poste, le général Vance a dirigé les efforts des @ForcesCanada pour défendre notre pays contre les menaces militaires et la COVID-19, et plus encore. Au nom du pays, je le remercie pour son service et son leadership.

Update: To prevent the new variant of COVID-19 from spreading in Canada, we’re extending the temporary suspension of passenger flights from the UK for another two weeks, until January 6th. We’ll continue to monitor the situation and do whatever it takes to keep you safe.

Mise à jour : Pour éviter que le variant de la COVID-19 se répande au Canada, on prolongera de 2 semaines, jusqu’au 6 janvier, la suspension temporaire des vols de passagers en provenance du Royaume-Uni. On surveille la situation et on va faire le nécessaire pour vous protéger.

This just in: @GovCanHealth has approved Moderna’s COVID-19 vaccine for use in Canada. We can’t let our guards down yet, though - we need to keep following public health guidelines and using the #COVIDAlert app. Click here to download it now: https://t.co/zJXF3jGz69 https://t.co/845nyKAH5b

Dernière heure : @GouvCanSante a approuvé l’utilisation du vaccin contre la COVID-19 de Moderna au Canada. Mais on ne peut pas baisser la garde. On doit suivre les directives de la santé publique et utiliser l’appli #AlerteCOVID. Téléchargez-la ici : https://t.co/vXHBQBjxcu https://t.co/qSdCGrYD5D

Dr. Tam (@CPHO_Canada), Dr. Njoo, and Ministers @PattyHajdu, @BillBlair, and @DLeBlancNB are giving an update on the current COVID-19 situation and speaking about what all of us can do to stay safe during the holidays. Tune in now for the latest: https://t.co/LMCM78nGSI

La Dre Tam (@ACSP_Canada), le Dr Njoo et les ministres @PattyHajdu, @BillBlair et @DLeBlancNB font le point sur la situation entourant la COVID-19 et parlent de ce que nous pouvons tous faire pour rester en sécurité pendant les Fêtes. Regardez en direct : https://t.co/PoVq0Nvm5h

We’re not out of the woods yet. COVID-19 cases are rising across the country. So as we head into the holidays, we need to remain vigilant. We need to keep doing the things we know work - things like wearing your mask, washing your hands, and avoiding gatherings.

On n’est pas encore sortis du bois. Le nombre de cas de COVID-19 est en hausse partout au pays. Alors que les Fêtes approchent, on doit rester vigilants. On doit continuer de faire les bons choix, comme porter le masque, se laver les mains et éviter les rassemblements.

This afternoon, I convened a meeting with the Incident Response Group. We focused on the new variant of COVID-19 identified in the UK, and we have decided to implement new border restrictions in order to keep you - and people right across the country - safe.

Cet après-midi, j’ai réuni le Groupe d’intervention en cas d’incident. Nous avons discuté du nouveau variant de la COVID-19 détecté au Royaume-Uni et avons décidé d’ajouter des restrictions à la frontière pour vous protéger ainsi que les gens de partout au pays.

If you don’t have the #COVIDAlert app yet, stop scrolling. Watch this video to see how using the app can help break the cycle of infection and slow the spread of the virus. Then, click here and join the 5.7 million Canadians who’ve downloaded it already: https://t.co/EVEiXvBo4i https://t.co/LU0joKGPmX

Update on vaccines: In January, we’ll be getting 125,000 doses of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine each week - for a total of 500,000 doses that month. With the guaranteed millions of doses coming into our country in 2021, every Canadian who wants a vaccine will be able to get one.

The pandemic, the holidays, our vaccine rollout, and what we’re doing to keep you safe and supported into the new year - I’m covering that and more in today’s update. Watch it live: https://t.co/eejSa0wm74
Hope you get well soon, @EmmanuelMacron. Sophie and I are sending you our warmest wishes. Let’s keep working together to end the pandemic.

I’m glad I could pop into one of these meetings this morning and say thank you, too - because I agree completely with Patty. You’ve been making a real difference. You’re the heroes of the pandemic. And it’s because of you that we’ll get through this crisis. https://t.co/kKVpjFqHXi

Doctors, nurses, and other medical professionals across the country have been doing incredible work to keep us safe - and that work continues with our vaccine rollout. This morning at the @OttawaHospital, @PattyHajdu and I were able to thank a few of those involved. https://t.co/07F8uXtgMh

As for the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine, which is already being administered in Canada, we’ve confirmed that about 200,000 of our total early order for 2020 will be delivered next week. Provinces will have 70 sites ready to administer these doses then, up from 14 sites this week.

These doses are part of the 40 million we’ve secured from Moderna, and deliveries could begin within 48 hours of regulatory approval. Because it’s easier to ship over long distances, doses of this vaccine will be directed to the North, and to remote and Indigenous communities.

Update: We’ve secured our second agreement for early doses of COVID-19 vaccines, this time with Moderna. We’ll receive up to 168,000 doses of their vaccine before the end of the month, pending approval from @GovCanHealth.

Mise à jour : on a conclu une deuxième entente pour la livraison anticipée de doses de vaccins contre la COVID-19, mais cette fois-ci avec Moderna. On va recevoir jusqu’à 168 000 doses de son vaccin avant la fin du mois, à condition qu’il soit approuvé par @GouvCanSante.

At the @OttawaHospital this morning, I got to speak with some of Ottawa’s first recipients of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine - and I got to meet some of those working behind the scenes to make this all possible. To them, and to everyone involved, I want to say thank you. https://t.co/zi16Mws2Ld

Anita Quidangen, a personal support worker in Toronto, was one of the first people in Canada to be given Pfizer-BioNTech’s COVID-19 vaccine. This is a big step forward in our fight against the virus, but we’re not out of the woods yet. https://t.co/BCEkdoBWqy

Ce matin, Gisèle Lévesque est devenue la première personne au Canada à avoir reçu le vaccin contre la COVID-19 de Pfizer-BioNTech. C’est une grande étape dans notre lutte contre le virus, mais tout n’est pas gagné. https://t.co/vIAYKHoDha

This is good news. But our fight against COVID-19 is not over. Now more than ever, let’s keep up our vigilance. Keep wearing your masks, washing your hands, avoiding gatherings, and using #COVIDAlert. Download it here: https://t.co/lpr1L6PEim
The first batch of doses of Pfizer-BioNTech’s COVID-19 vaccine have arrived in Canada. https://t.co/xSvwkRROKo

C’est une bonne nouvelle, mais notre lutte contre la COVID-19 n’est pas finie. Plus que jamais, restons vigilants. Continuez de porter votre masque, de vous laver les mains, d’éviter les rassemblements et d’utiliser #AlerteCOVID. Téléchargez-la ici : https://t.co/mEQNdVHKCn
Les premières livraisons de doses du vaccin contre la COVID-19 de Pfizer-BioNTech viennent d’arriver au Canada. https://t.co/hGCAspz3Jq

Our fight against COVID-19 is not over. If we don’t want to see over 12,000 new cases every day next month, we need to reduce our contacts right away. We also need to keep wearing our masks, washing our hands, avoiding gatherings, and using #COVIDAlert: https://t.co/lpr1L6PEim

La lutte contre la COVID-19 se poursuit. Pour ne pas avoir plus de 12 000 cas par jour le mois prochain, on doit réduire nos contacts en personne à l’instant. Alors portez le masque, évitez les rassemblements, lavez-vous les mains et utilisez #AlerteCOVID: https://t.co/mEQNdVHKCn

This pandemic is the most serious public health crisis our country has ever faced. We'll continue to be there for the provinces and territories - and for you - as we get through this crisis together. More on what we spoke about with the premiers today: https://t.co/CrTYGc6Rzt

We’ve just wrapped up our meeting with the premiers - our 23rd of the year - where we spoke about our shared fight against COVID-19, our vaccine rollout, and strengthening health care. Tune in now for an update on the work we’re doing: https://t.co/hPhujxNJTs

Nous venons de terminer notre rencontre avec les premiers ministres - la 23e de l’année. Au menu : notre lutte contre la COVID-19, notre campagne de vaccination et le renforcement des soins de santé. Voyez maintenant où en est le travail que nous faisons : https://t.co/F4GSYSAXTf

Had a good chat with @FureyAndrew. We talked about the pandemic, our vaccine rollout, and shared priorities - including clean energy and the Atlantic Loop, and support for workers in sectors that’ve been hit hard this year. On these and other issues, we’ll keep working together.

Update on Pfizer-BioNTech’s COVID-19 vaccine that was just approved by Health Canada: 30,000 doses are expected to arrive as early as Monday at the 14 points of shipment across the country. Up to 249,000 doses are coming this month, with millions more in the new year.

Remember, a vaccine can’t help you if you get sick right now. So we need to keep following public health guidelines and using the #COVIDAlert app. Click here to put the app on your phone today: https://t.co/uwoYEBx9Hr

After a thorough and rigorous review process, Health Canada has approved Pfizer-BioNTech’s COVID-19 vaccine. The first shipment of doses is tracking for delivery soon. This is all good news - but it doesn’t mean we can let our guards down. https://t.co/Tl7uTBPWsR

Après un examen rigoureux et approfondi, Santé Canada a approuvé le vaccin de Pfizer-BioNTech contre la COVID-19. Les premières doses devraient être livrées bientôt. C’est une bonne nouvelle, mais ça ne veut pas dire qu’on peut baisser la garde. https://t.co/TtjDnpdNU8

You’ve certainly made a positive impact - from the @Chiefs O-line to our D-line against the pandemic, your drive and dedication have no doubt inspired people across the country. Congratulations, Laurent! This recognition is well-deserved. https://t.co/1kLS4TkzGD

Pfizer, the Public Health Agency, and the provinces are working together to finalize preparations at the first 14 delivery points this week. Get the details of our vaccine rollout and what we’re doing to protect you here: https://t.co/wkjfOXAj9E

UPDATE ON VACCINES: Canada has secured an agreement with Pfizer to begin early delivery of doses of Pfizer-BioNTech’s COVID-19 vaccine. We’re scheduled to receive up to 249,000 of our initial doses this month, with millions more on the way.

MISE À JOUR CONCERNANT LES VACCINS : Le Canada a conclu une entente avec Pfizer pour commencer plus tôt la livraison des doses du vaccin de Pfizer-BioNTech contre la COVID-19. Nous allons donc recevoir jusqu’à 249 000 doses initiales ce mois-ci, suivies des millions déjà prévues.

Update for business owners: If your business has been hit hard by the pandemic, you can now access another loan through the Canada Emergency Business Account - this one up to $20,000. That’s on top of the $40,000 already available. Click here to apply: https://t.co/FZqA5CXV58
As we head into the weekend, I’m giving an update on the pandemic, our response, and more. Watch my Friday update live for the latest: https://t.co/mzEsY5JHsL

Today, I met with leaders of faith groups from across the country. They spoke about all that they’ve been doing during the pandemic - they’ve stepped up to help their neighbours and serve their communities, and they’ve been doing it with fewer resources than usual. https://t.co/KrrepOb8n4

Update: Johnson & Johnson have submitted their vaccine candidate to Health Canada for review. Potential vaccines from Pfizer-BioNTech, AstraZeneca-Oxford, and Moderna are already under review - and if it’s safe and approved, we are guaranteed some of Moderna’s first batch.
I’m back to give an update on the current COVID-19 situation, and to talk about the Fall Economic Statement we shared yesterday. Tune in now for the latest on that and more: https://t.co/5gLQC09OO8

Je suis de retour pour faire le point sur la situation de la COVID-19 et parler de l’Énoncé économique de l’automne qui a été présenté hier. J’aborde ces sujets et bien d’autres en direct : https://t.co/icafAvYOFI

Our shelves are stocked and our families are fed in large part because Canada’s dairy, poultry, and egg farmers have been working hard through the pandemic. They’re an essential part of our economy, and we’re committed to supporting the supply-managed sector. More here ⤵️ https://t.co/fb0ct1XGB5

Tomorrow in the House, we’ll introduce our Fall Economic Statement - it’ll cover how we’re rebuilding a strong and resilient economy, and what we’re doing to support you through the pandemic. In the meantime, here’s a recap of some of the benefits we’ve created to help you. ⤵️ https://t.co/iCl7CprXER

If you’re a small business owner who’s been affected by COVID-19, the Canada Emergency Rent Subsidy could cover up to 65% of your rent. If your community is in lockdown, the new Lockdown Support could boost your rent subsidy up to 90%. Click here to apply: https://t.co/F8Hrc20YLm

If you can’t work because you’re sick or need to self-isolate due to COVID-19, there’s the Canada Recovery Sickness Benefit. If you can’t work because you’re taking care of a loved one, there’s the Canada Recovery Caregiving Benefit. Click here for more: https://t.co/FnNdimxVWh

If you’re directly affected by COVID-19 but you’re self-employed or don’t qualify for Employment Insurance, the Canada Recovery Benefit is there for you. It’ll provide you with $500 each week for up to 26 weeks. Click here to learn more and apply today: https://t.co/kTa8Mhksy6

La Subvention d’urgence du Canada pour le loyer couvre jusqu’à 65% du loyer des petites entreprises touchées par la COVID-19. Si votre communauté est confinée, la Mesure de soutien en cas de confinement augmente la Subvention au loyer à 90%. Demandez-les : https://t.co/9wl4kfoKIb

Pour ceux qui ont la COVID-19 et qui sont incapables de travailler, il y a la Prestation de maladie pour la relance économique. Ceux qui s’absentent pour s’occuper d’un proche ont la Prestation de la relance économique pour proches aidants : https://t.co/RuE5IWiBMO

La Prestation canadienne de relance économique s’adresse aux travailleurs autonomes non admissibles à l’assurance-emploi qui sont directement touchés par la COVID‑19. Ils recevront 500$/sem. durant 26 semaines au maximum. Pour info et pour la demander : https://t.co/dznd5WGdrB

We’ve already purchased freezers that’ll work for specific vaccine candidates - and we’ll continue to coordinate with the provinces, territories, and Indigenous communities so we can reach everyone who wants a vaccine, no matter where they live.

You don’t have to face this crisis alone - we’re here for you. In today’s update, I’m going over the supports we’ve put in place for you, talking about our vaccine rollout, and announcing funding that’ll help Indigenous children and families. Tune in now: https://t.co/INU9d3H6eD

Earlier this evening, @DLeBlancNB and I spoke with the premiers. The agenda for tonight’s meeting included updates on business supports, vaccine candidates, our planned rollout, and more. We’ll continue to work together and do whatever it takes to keep you safe.

We’ve received more than 24 million syringes and needles, which we’ll use when we have a vaccine. On that front, we heard promising news yesterday about AstraZeneca and Oxford University’s vaccine candidate. We already have an agreement for up to 20 million doses of it.
Watch my Tuesday update live for the latest on COVID-19, therapeutics, and our plan to do whatever it takes, for as long as it takes, to help you and your family: https://t.co/fihmSU1pw0

Regardez en direct ma mise à jour du mardi concernant la COVID-19, les produits thérapeutiques et notre plan visant à prendre toutes les mesures nécessaires, aussi longtemps qu’il le faudra, pour vous et votre famille : https://t.co/Zi8tL6TX8E

If your business is facing a public health lockdown order, you can also apply for the new Lockdown Support and boost your rent subsidy by 25% - so hard-hit businesses could get a rent subsidy of up to 90%. Learn more and apply here: https://t.co/oWecdQ8OfN. We’ve got your back.

Update: As of today, business owners can apply for new support measures. If your small business has been affected by COVID-19, the new Canada Emergency Rent Subsidy is there for you - it’ll now come directly to you, not through your landlord, and cover up to 65% of your rent.

Lancement de nouvelles mesures d’aide aujourd’hui pour les propriétaires d’entreprise : si votre petite entreprise a été touchée par la COVID-19, demandez la Subvention d’urgence du Canada pour le loyer, qui vous sera versée directement et couvrira jusqu’à 65 % de votre loyer.

Just announced: @CAFreeland will introduce our Fall Economic Statement next Monday. It’ll give you an update on our plan to continue doing whatever it takes to support you through this crisis, and ensure a strong economic recovery after we’ve beat COVID-19.

If you haven’t already downloaded the #COVIDAlert app, click here: https://t.co/qRWzsJkGpD. If you ever test positive, put your one-time code into the app. It’ll then let others know they’ve been exposed and should get tested - and it’ll help slow the spread of the virus.

As you can see, the #G20 Summit looked different this year. But we still need to work together to address challenges like COVID-19 and climate change. Our future depends on our ability to do so. For more on what we spoke about, click here: https://t.co/FINZSM5IPd https://t.co/7Je2KsZhYI

Comme vous pouvez le voir, le Sommet du #G20 était différent cette année. Mais on doit encore travailler ensemble pour relever les défis comme la COVID-19 et les changements climatiques. Notre avenir en dépend. Pour en savoir plus sur nos discussions : https://t.co/8xb1y1A9ig https://t.co/0M6QCEXmPA

On vient de voir les dernières projections de la Dre Tam et du Dr Njoo. La situation est grave. Regardez ma mise à jour du vendredi pour connaître les derniers développements concernant la COVID-19 : https://t.co/X27lSpuD5w

Happening now: Minister @PattyHajdu, Dr. Tam, and Dr. Njoo are giving an update on the current COVID-19 situation and sharing the latest projections for where we could be heading. Watch live for more information: https://t.co/p22yLj4T2W

En direct : la ministre @PattyHajdu, la Dre Tam et le Dr Njoo font le point sur la COVID-19 et présentent les dernières projections quant à l’évolution de la situation. Regardez ici : https://t.co/PA4nH650pP

Tomorrow, Dr. Tam and Dr. Njoo will highlight the latest modelling data and projections. You’ll see that it’s critical that you keep following public health measures. Wash your hands. Limit close contacts. Wear your mask. Download and use #COVIDAlert: https://t.co/J0N5t2Fjx8

Today, I brought together the opposition leaders for a briefing with Dr. Tam, Dr. Njoo, and @PattyHajdu to go over the current COVID-19 numbers. The situation is serious. The health of Canadians is our top priority, and we must continue to work together to keep people safe.

Aujourd’hui, j’ai discuté de la COVID-19 avec les chefs de l’opposition, la Dre Tam, le Dr Njoo et @PattyHajdu. La situation est grave. La santé des Canadiens est notre priorité et nous devons continuer de travailler ensemble pour assurer la sécurité des gens.

Earlier tonight, Premier @JJHorgan and I talked on the phone about the current COVID-19 situation, our response to the pandemic, and the need to keep working together to get this second wave under control.

Plus tôt ce soir, j’ai parlé avec le premier ministre @JJHorgan de la situation entourant la COVID-19, de notre réponse face à la pandémie et de la nécessité de continuer à travailler ensemble pour maîtriser cette deuxième vague.

I just spoke with Premier @JSavikataaq about the situation on the ground in Nunavut. As of today, a territory-wide lockdown is in effect. We’ve provided them with personal protective equipment and other support - and we’ll continue to work together to keep people safe.

The news about Moderna’s vaccine candidate is encouraging - and we’ve secured tens of millions of doses for Canadians. But that won’t help you if you get sick right now. It can only protect you once you’ve had the shot. Until then, we must continue to follow public health rules.

La nouvelle concernant le candidat-vaccin de Moderna est encourageante. On en a déjà réservé des millions de doses pour les Canadiens. Mais ça sera inutile si vous tombez malade maintenant. En attendant de pouvoir être vacciné, continuez de suivre les règles de la santé publique.

We’ll continue to do whatever it takes, for as long as it takes, to keep you safe from COVID-19. But we need you to do your part, too. Watch our Tuesday update for the latest on our response to the pandemic, how you can help, and more: https://t.co/UNb7P7amcE

On fera tout ce qu’on peut, pour aussi longtemps qu’il le faudra, afin de vous protéger contre la COVID-19. Mais vous devez aussi faire votre part. Regardez notre mise à jour pour connaître nos dernières mesures, savoir comment nous aider et plus : https://t.co/w4pbZodLoH

Have you seen Germany’s new ads about COVID-19? It doesn’t matter what language you speak, the message is clear. You can be the hero in the fight against this virus - and you don’t even have to do that much. https://t.co/oVWwQ2eBln

Avez-vous vu les nouvelles publicités de l’Allemagne concernant la COVID-19? Quelle que soit la langue que l’on parle, le message est clair. Vous pouvez être le héros du combat contre le virus... sans trop d’efforts! https://t.co/kiLX17ss0P

I spoke on the phone with @MinPres Rutte today. We caught each other up on what we’re doing to protect people from COVID-19, and we agreed to keep advancing our shared priorities - like fighting climate change and promoting human rights - together.

Aujourd’hui, j’ai parlé avec le @MinPres Rutte. On a discuté de ce qu’on fait pour protéger les gens de la COVID-19 et on a convenu de faire avancer ensemble nos priorités communes comme le climat et les droits de la personne.

We need to keep working together to plank the curve and protect each other. It won’t always be easy, but it’ll definitely be worth it. So wear your mask. Wash your hands. Keep your distance. And use the #COVIDAlert app: https://t.co/3Om9LIZvIn https://t.co/zI5qdgTgUb

I know you’re tired of hearing that, but we need to keep doing our part. So download the #COVIDAlert app here: https://t.co/4aeZXYyH6Y. Then, if you end up testing positive, enter your code into the app. That’ll allow it to do its work - and help us slow the spread of this virus.

Our fight against COVID-19 is far from over. Cases are still rising, and we’re seeing record spikes across the country. We need to reverse these trends right now. We need to wash our hands, wear our masks, keep our distance, and download the #COVIDAlert app.

Notre lutte contre la COVID-19 est loin d’être finie. Les cas continuent d’augmenter et il y a des hausses record au pays. Il faut renverser cette tendance maintenant. On doit se laver les mains, porter le masque, garder nos distances et télécharger l’appli #AlerteCOVID.

Across the country, COVID-19 cases are rising at an alarming rate. @DLeBlancNB and I spoke about that with the premiers this evening. We asked what more support they need to protect people in each province and territory. We’ll keep working together to protect your health.

Les cas de COVID-19 augmentent à une vitesse alarmante. @DLeBlancNB et moi en avons parlé avec les premiers ministres. On leur a demandé ce qu’on pouvait faire de plus pour protéger les gens dans chaque province et territoire. On continuera à travailler ensemble pour vous.

I joined the #FTGlobalBoardroom to discuss Canada’s response to the pandemic. We’re doing whatever it takes to support jobs and businesses, and move our country forward. More here: https://t.co/etswCyfLuL

Can you save Boston’s life? There are two ways you can help: If you’re half-Caucasian and half-Filipino, please reach out to @CanadasLifeline and see how you can become a stem cell donor. If you aren’t, you can still share this story and spread the word. https://t.co/IBNelTIGqg

On the phone today, @SpeakerPelosi and I spoke about strengthening the partnership between our two countries - and what more we can do to beat the pandemic, create good jobs, and tackle climate change. We also spoke about honouring our veterans on this solemn day of remembrance.

COVID-19 cases are rising across Calgary - Mayor @Nenshi and I spoke about that today, and I asked what more we can do to help keep people safe. We also spoke about infrastructure priorities, ending homelessness, and how we can support Calgarians through this pandemic and beyond.

Aujourd’hui, j’ai parlé avec le maire @Nenshi de la hausse des cas de COVID-19 à Calgary, de ce qu’on peut faire pour protéger les gens, des priorités en matière d’infrastructure, de l’élimination de l’itinérance et de la façon d’aider les Calgariens pendant et après la pandémie.

As the pandemic continues to impact countries around the world, we must keep working with our partners to protect people's health and help our economies recover. Today, I spoke about that and more with @BorisJohnson. Read a summary of our call: https://t.co/LN1brtFVkM

I just spoke with @JoeBiden, and congratulated him again on his election. We’ve worked with each other before, and we’re ready to pick up on that work and tackle the challenges and opportunities facing our two countries - including climate change and COVID-19. https://t.co/wldIwLSz5H

J’ai parlé avec @JoeBiden et je l’ai encore félicité pour son élection. Nous avons déjà travaillé ensemble et nous sommes prêts à reprendre ce travail et à relever les défis et opportunités auxquels nos 2 pays sont confrontés, notamment les changements climatiques et la COVID-19. https://t.co/OazmtHzXNy

We’re heading into another weekend, and we all need to keep doing our part to beat this virus. For the latest on the pandemic and how we’re responding, tune in to our Friday update now: https://t.co/S3JyYkMgKV

I’m taking questions from @KwantlenU students, staff, and faculty right now - we’re talking about the current COVID-19 situation, our ongoing response, and so much more. You can watch our conversation live by clicking here: https://t.co/zAUzgDdnFW

Je réponds en ce moment aux questions des étudiants, du personnel et des enseignants de la @KwantlenU au sujet de la pandémie de COVID-19, de notre réponse et plus encore. Vous pouvez regarder notre conversation en direct ici : https://t.co/zAUzgDdnFW

There’s nothing more important to us than making sure your family has the support it needs - during the pandemic and beyond. L’application Alerte COVID permet non seulement de vous protéger, mais aussi de ralentir la propagation du virus et de prévenir de futures vagues. Plus de gens la téléchargeront, plus elle sera utile. Voici comment l’installer sur votre téléphone : https://t.co/fjFadvUgtG

Aux Néo-Brunswickois et Saskatchewanais : l’application Alerte COVID est disponible chez vous! Cet outil, qui s’ajoute aux consignes en matière de santé publique, vous aidera à assurer votre sécurité ainsi que celle de vos proches et de nos travailleurs de première ligne.

I spoke on the phone with @EmmanuelMacron today. We talked about current global issues - including the ongoing pandemic, the steps we’re taking to keep people safe, and the need for a green recovery that creates good jobs. More on our call: https://t.co/daHlnHXlXM

COVID-19 remains a serious public health threat. And as people around the world continue to deal with this pandemic, our Safe Restart Agreement with the provinces and territories will help keep you safe and get you the support you need. Get the details: https://t.co/JxAJFTsthM

La COVID-19 reste une grave menace pour la santé publique. Et pendant que le monde continue de gérer cette pandémie, l’Accord sur la relance sécuritaire conclu avec les provinces et les territoires va contribuer à vous protéger et à vous aider. Détails : https://t.co/TK7hEiWt4t

Over the past few days, our team has been meeting to talk about the pandemic, the economy, and our plan to keep you safe and supported in the weeks and months ahead. Tune in now for an update on the work we’re doing: https://t.co/nAwalUWfaz

I touched base with Chancellor Merkel this morning. We covered a number of global issues, and focused on how our countries are responding to the pandemic and keeping people safe. More on our call: https://t.co/HAjQQdooiJ

Democracy has an important role to play in helping us confront COVID-19. Because of that, it’s more important than ever that we keep protecting and promoting our democratic traditions and values - and supporting democracy around the world. #DemocracyDay https://t.co/mrya9EPOfN

La démocratie a un rôle à jouer dans la lutte contre la COVID-19. Il est donc important que nous continuions à protéger et à promouvoir nos traditions et nos valeurs démocratiques et à soutenir la démocratie dans le monde. #JournéeDeLaDémocratie https://t.co/x4YchtlWzp

Just spoke with @BlaineHiggs2020 and congratulated him on his re-election. I look forward to continuing our work together on the Safe Restart Agreement, the Atlantic Growth Strategy, and keeping New Brunswickers safe and supported through this pandemic. https://t.co/MEgWgAa0F7

As the world continues to deal with the impacts of this pandemic, keeping you safe and getting you the support you need remains our top priority. That’s what we focused on at our Cabinet retreat today, and that’s what will be on the agenda when we meet again tomorrow. https://t.co/jiUU0gCb4e

We’re holding a Cabinet retreat in Ottawa next week, and we’ll focus on making sure you are safe and supported during this pandemic. We’ll also discuss the path to recovery - and keep building a Canada that is greener and more resilient. Get the details: https://t.co/cgBwiG3px7

On the phone today, @GavinNewsom and I spoke about the wildfires burning across California - Canadians are keeping everyone affected by the fires in our thoughts. We also talked about the pandemic, its impacts, and our economic recovery. More on our call: https://t.co/rcA3w4o6be

And the folks from Tronosjet Maintenance started making thermometer covers when they heard the nearby hospital was running low on them. They’re also making nasal swabs and mask straps, and I passed along my thanks for how they’ve stepped up in this time of need. https://t.co/U5NTzhZYbC

I also met with Sebastien and the @FilsDuRoy team. They used the Canada Emergency Business Account program to keep their doors open, and then they retooled to produce hand sanitizer for essential workers. I let them know how grateful we are for the work they’ve done. https://t.co/GNt3oAMQS3

Newfoundlanders and Labradorians: the COVID Alert app is now available for you to use. It’ll help you protect yourself, your loved ones, and our front line workers - so make sure you download it. The more people who do, the more useful it’ll be. https://t.co/sfUQhxXPja

Terre-Neuve-et-Labrador : l’application Alerte COVID vous est maintenant accessible. Elle contribuera à vous protéger et à protéger vos proches et nos travailleurs de première ligne, alors téléchargez-la. Plus les gens le feront, plus elle sera utile. https://t.co/vyVfp74GY6

We covered a lot of ground in today’s meeting - from the ongoing pandemic to the opioid crisis. We also talked about fair trade and what our governments are doing to help keep our kids safe as they head back to school. Together, we’ll continue working on these and other issues.

In January, it was a snowstorm that kept Premier @JJHorgan and I from meeting in person - this time, it was the pandemic. So we logged on for the second time this year to talk about the issues that matter most to British Columbians and the work we’re doing to keep you safe. https://t.co/8qqONuSgUv

Fighting violent extremism, advancing gender equality, working on equitable access to COVID-19 vaccines, building a safer world - we covered all that and more during this morning’s Aqaba Process meeting with @KingAbdullahII, @DonicaPottie, and our partners from around the world. https://t.co/9oMIuIbPYO

Lutte contre l’extrémisme violent, égalité des genres, accès équitable aux vaccins contre la COVID-19, création d’un monde plus sûr : on a notamment couvert ces dossiers durant la réunion du processus d’Aqaba avec le @KingAbdullahII, @DonicaPottie et d’autres partenaires. https://t.co/ybgaF0MNoY

This investment will increase the facility’s ability to manufacture vaccines - by next year, they’ll be able to produce up to two million doses per month here at Royalmount - and will strengthen @NRC_CNRC’s partnerships with vaccine developers. This morning in Montreal, we announced the steps we’re taking to make sure we have access to potential COVID-19 vaccines.
